page.title: 20Junior Fishing,Leamington
page.content: On a Wednesday night at six o'clock there is a fishing competion.We wait until a man comes and then we pay twenty pence, which is how much it costs to enter, and then we pick a piece of card with a number on it and then we walk up the bank until we come to the peg number that matches the one we have on the card we picked out of the bag.Then we have until half past six to tackle up.Then at quarter to nine we pack up and the organisers come round and way our catch.If you win you get a trophy which has a metal fisherman on it.It is also based on an aggregate over thirteen weeks so you get 15 points for 1st,14 points for 2nd and so on.Then the winner over the thirteen weeks gets a cup and the top 15 over all get into the leamington team who fish againts other teams all over warwickshire.
